title: A fantastic evening and a great waitress!

content: ['Having frequented various Ivy restaurants and been very happy with both food and service, I selected this one for a birthday brunch with friends for my wife. This went off to a bad start because, the waitress spotted that I had brought my own birthday cake with me and wanted to take that away to the reception. ', 'Following, I asked to speak to a manager about this and had an unfortunate experience talking to Audrius, who I found lacked any kind of human emotion and was frankly facetious and patronising, there was obviously no negotiation on their matter of their "health and safety policy" over bringing external cakes, although it was clear from Audrius that the issue was really about the effect it would have on dessert sales. Audrius explained that this happens a lot, and many guest find themselves in my position and allowing any discretion would mean people: "bringing their own wine or dogs to the restaurant”. This indicates to me, that customers have a desire to do exactly as I had done, and that the restaurant itself is not listening to customers’ desires or needs. Anyway, the discussion ended with him saying "You have a choice to make?", when I enquired as to the choice, I was told: "To sit down and enjoy your meal or not?", which I thought was unprofessional. If this was my brand I would not have such a person represent it.', 'Notwithstanding that the Ivy is not a patisserie, does not specialise in birthday cakes and anything they would have offered would have been far inferior. What is more frustrating is that when I called the restaurant prior to the booking, I was told that they can only provide birthday cakes for up to 5 people, and since there were 8 of us, this was not an option. Although Audrius insisted this was not the case, so not only poor management, but poor staff advice led to this situation occurring.', 'Even other restaurant guests who overheard the conversation made the effort to to approach us and offer their supporting voices that this was a ridiculous policy.', 'Talking to one of the other managers, Alex, when we left, who I found much more personable, and at least had the trait of human empathy, which honestly is the minimum I would expect from anyone in the hospitality industry. It was nice that someone in the restaurant was able to consider my situation and that of my guests from our perspective.', 'Food was less than the Ivy standard I have come to know which was extremely disappointing, especially as I introduced so many people to the Ivy for the first time and talked it up, perhaps it was just this particular restaurant, but I will never come here again, nor would I expect that from my guests who came for the first time. Several of us, commented was lacking in various ways. Unfortunately this occasion did not live up to my high expectations from the Ivy that I\'ve enjoyed at many other locations across London as a regular customer, but the "Ivy in the Park - Canary Wharf" has left me burnt and offended.', 'I seriously urge a reconsideration on the birthday cake policy, it’s surely a classic managerial short sightedness where you intend to increase revenue by potentially increasing sales of desserts on a single occasion, but neglect that you offend customers and limit future sales when people who’ve enjoyed friendly and accommodating service come back time and time again. Not to mention that even bringing your own cake means that customers would still purchase teas and coffees. Due to the hostility in this restaurant we took the cake and made the celebrations at another local venue who were more than happy to give us a table when we purchased a few drinks to go with it!']
title: Not Birthday Celebration Friendly! Beware.

content: ['Visited on a Saturday night. Lovely welcome and our initial waitress was pleasant and engaged with us. The food was mostly lovely. The exception was the chips, they were dry, tasteless & oven cooked in our opinion, We ordered wine and our main course was served before it arrived at the table. From this point on the new female server, now in a black suit did not engage with us. Our wine & water were topped up as she passed with out a single glance at us and the bottles replaced on the table with a definite thump. We were not asked if we wanted dessert but the menu was plonked in front of us without comment. We were then left for at least 20 minutes before anyone asked us if we wanted to order. As we wanted some cheese to go with our remaining wine we sat sipping water, once ordered the cheese took ages to arrive to the point that we asked ourselves who had ordered something complicated! The background music was too loud, without any discernible tune and had a constant beat that made it hard to ignore and conversation difficult. On a separate note ladies have to queue in the corridor before they even get onto the Ladies toilets and 3 cubicles for a restaurant of this size is inadequate. For a chain that pitches themselves as luxury we felt that they need to try a lot harder.']

title: Overpriced

content: ['The aesthetics of the place is clearly its selling point: a beautiful dining room clearly designed with excellent attention to detail. ', "We made a reservation for breakfast, however we were delayed by public transport and called to say we'd be there before 11:30 (when breakfast ended). They told me it was no problem and turned up at 11:25. I had to specifically ask for the breakfast menu - which I understand - and asked if we were still in time for breakfast, something our server had to double-check. I knew it was pushing it a little bit (11:27), but reassured them we knew it was late and we would be very quick in ordering.", 'A manager then came to us asking what the problem was, although how this became a big problem is still unknown to me (something our server later kindly apologised for). We had to explain that we had been delayed and wished to have breakfast there. He then asked us if we had booked for breakfast and said “do you know already what you want to order?”, which made us feel unwelcome and rushed, considering it was our first time and had still not been given the menu. After an uncalled joke, he then gave us the menu and we quickly picked our items, while the waitress was standing in front of us (11:31 was in fact the time printed on the bill).', 'Our hot drinks came quickly (though one of them was a hot very sweet white chocolate, instead of a standard hot chocolate) and a while after came the food. I did not want to complain about the mistake and kept my chocolate as it was. Coffee was good, but not remarkable.', 'The pancakes were also good, although the strawberries tasted funny and the yogurt made them a little floppy and not easy to swallow. The eggs were nice and so was the croissant. At one point we were asked if we wanted to water and were given a still bottle, without being asked if we preferred sparkling. Surely not the end of the world, but I would expect that in a fine-dining restaurant.', 'The very lovely and unexpected touch was when we were given a birthday treat with a candle on, which we very much appreciated. Our server Stephanie was also kind enough to offer to take a picture for us. ', 'To sum up: ', 'the place looks stunning and refined. The service could use some fine tuning, though as I said Stephanie B. was very nice and quickly made up for the initial slip. Breakfast food is okay, it was good but neither of us were mind-blown. ', "We don't look forward to going back very soon, but may give it another go in the future, hoping that we will be treated a bit better."]

We arrived at 5pm, service started at 5. 17 and we left at 18.08. It was a very short, and disappointing birthday celebration.']
title: Sorry, but I don’t do mice

content: ['The Ivy is a good option for brunch; we had eggs royale as well as eggs benedict, the latter missing a bit of salt and which could have had slightly more hollandaise sauce. Although a bit pricy compared to similar venues, those dishes are accompanied with fries, which is a plus! The highlight was the taste of the arancini, which were lovely. ']
title: Don't miss out on the Arancini

content: ['Great attentive service, delicious food, cocktails are just amazing, specially Salted caramel expresso martini. It was so professional touch with congratulations plaque for our special occasion. Just good vibes and pretty atmosphere. Will go there again and again.']
title: Beautiful experience

content: ['Enjoyable family lunch again. Can’t fault the place, service and staff. Very good Gin selection. ', 'Suggestion: add more choices of craft beers. ']
title: Great place

content: ['visited last Saturday for lunch at 2pm so arrived at 1 to be seated at the bar which serves really clean fresh drinks, a great bar, great bar staff. After being seated in the all day restaurant we were offered 2 menus one of which was vegetarian, a pleasant change and great selection. The waiting staff were excellent and very professional, this restaurant should make the others in Canary Wharf sit up as its head and shoulders above most if not all. I hope they keep up the standards.']
title: A pleasant change

content: ['Located in Canary Wharf, this restaurant was a perfect cap to the day . It had lots of windows overlooking the lawn with an eclectic British decor . The seating was comfortable which lenses itself to a night of fun and fellowship . The service was professional and efficient . We had the vegetable and real Shepherds pie . Both were delicious and served with Sauce . The fresh vegetables were prepared perfectly as an accompaniment . The bar service was the only slow service of the night . The desserts were spectacular . Overall a delightful experience . ']
title: Great experience with good food and ambience

content: ["I came in today for lunch with an ex colleague and to be fair it was very good, I had the salmon fishcake with a side and it couldn't be faulted.", 'The service was equally very good.', "It can be noisy when it's busy but I'd definitely return, the Ivy team did a great job today."]
title: Quick lunch visit was very good

content: ["I have been working in Canary since 2017 and I have to say that The Ivy in The Park is the most well-structured restaurant in the area. Interior design, relaxing vibes, great atmosphere in combination with the outstanding service that I received made me feel so welcome. Genuine conversations with our main waiter, the manager made us feel like we knew each other for years. Excellent European food with plenty of options ,fantastic cocktails. It's a must, will definitely visit again and again again!"]
title: Hospitality at its finest!!

content: ["Let me start by saying this restaurant has a great atmosphere. The decor is beautiful and it has a very positive energy. The ginger beer is refreshing, and I highly recommend it. But that's where the positives stop. The service was slow and lackluster. The food was average at best. I definitely expected more from an Ivy restaurant. In my opinion, it did not live up to the Ivy standard. "]
title: Disappointed

content: ['I had my mothers 50th birthday celebrations at The Ivy on Saturday, the booking was at 3.30 pm for 12 people. I have been to their restaurants loads of times so thought it would be the perfect venue for a surprise afternoon tea. The tea was lovely and the men who served us were great and helpful.', 'The issue is I called up that morning to let them specifically know this was a surprise afternoon tea for my mums 50th so she had no idea about her friends and family being there, I asked if they could make a note and let reception know and I was assured this would be done and made a note of so nobody said anything when we arrived to give it away.', "When we arrived at The Ivy and I told them my name the woman on reception said 'oh yes I think your other guests are here'. I tried covering this up and saying oh no there are no other guests but it was too late my mum had already heard and asked questions so she knew.", 'I know this would have been an accident but the fact I called to mention beforehand and then my mums surprise was totally ruined is a real shame and I expected better from such a well known brand and restaurant.']
title: A surprise afternoon tea that turned into not so much of a surprise!

content: ['Had a birthday lunch with my husband. The food and service was excellent. I thought it was going to really expensive it was reasonable. ', 'It was a warm day we sat upstairs which is partly open which was lovely. ', 'I will be returning.']
title: Birthday Lunch

content: ['What a pleasure to find this eatery. Felt totally looked after, even though we only ordered tonic water and one food course each. Noteworthy attention to detail. Menu is interesting. I had the Monkfish and Prawn Curry, brilliant. ', 'Found it hard to locate, good landmark is Waitrose, The Ivy is in the park opposite.']
title: Attention to Detail

content: ['Plenty of staff doing the rounds - none seemingly doing anything. 15 mins to take first drink order on a reserved table, in a what looked to be half full restaurant. Both main courses removed from bill as inedible (burger far too charred and cut up as if to check readiness? Sea Bass same overpowering charred flavour?). ', 'Ultimately a disappointing visit. Wouldn’t go again. One good is they made a very good cocktail off-menu, but that did not restore faith in The Ivy.']
title: Disappointing to say the least

content: ['I wandered in with a friend of mine for a quick Sunday brunch, and was immediately greeted by friendly receptionists and incredible decor. We have been showed to the cute table in the garden area. We have started with some zucchini and arancini, then followed with eggs benedict and royale that exceeded our expectations and are definitely best in town! All of this accompanied by their excellent selection of drinks. The icing on the cake was their salted caramel espresso martini so make sure you try it! Can’t recommend enough!']
title: Best of the Ivy Collection!

content: ['I came to celebrate my job promotion with work friends and from the time I entered the Ivy to the last step out it was amazing!! From start to end we had the most welcoming and polite waiter/waitress- I have to mention Alex and Marianne who firstly didn’t let our glasses go empty and secondly, Alex provided us with top entertainment as well as perfect hospitality! I’m so happy Vanessa introduced the Ivy to us and made us have such a great time! ', 'The venue is so pretty and a great vibe. The food is just as nice! We especially loved the desserts-Totally recommend it :)']
title: Dinner

content: ['Took a friend for a birthday meal and everything was perfect. The white onion soup was so tasty and hot too and the bread was delicious. Main courses of chicken Milanese and Shepherds pie were really good. The best Shepherds pie I’ve ever had. The chocolate bomb desert was really nice without being heavy or too rich. ', 'They brought my friend out a little cake with a candle. All the staff are fantastic, friendly and did a great job. ', 'I thoroughly recommend this restaurant and we will definitely be going back. ']
title: Superb meal

content: ['Amazing service from our main sever ridge supported by George and alex (possible managers im not sure) showing great team work throughout our visit,lovely drinks runner charlie was chatty and friendly when delivering cocktails. Food was excellently paired with the recommended red wine. Great company product knowledge from all staff will visit again!']

['Love all about The Ivy! Had another fantastic experience in the Canary Wharf branch. Staff and food never disappointing. Big thank you to our wonderful waitress, who promptly served us with our limited time before cinema. Asparagus with lobster and Milanese so so delicious! ']
title: Fantastic

content: ['We enjoyed an unplanned visit for dinner whilst in the area and enjoyed a lovely evening eating delicious food with wine topped off with the sublime salted caramel espresso martini recommended by our waitress. Staff were attentive and friendly throughout. We thought that the menu was good value.', 'We really enjoyed the ambience of the restaurant, it was very relaxed.The decor with the garden planting was very comfortable. I would recomment this restaurant if you are visiting the area.']
title: Beautiful food, beautiful decor

content: ['Delicious food. From the moment you arrive and have the most perfect zucchini fries. Care and attention is taken to every course- the food is absolutely wonderful. Staff are incredibly attentive to your every need. Decor is truly special and the fragrance throughout the restaurant (in particular the rest rooms) is divine. 5* experience.']
title: Wonderful date night

content: ['Gorgeous restaurant with so many beautiful corners, garden, ground floor and romantic first floor. We felt so welcomed by staff and reception team, who accommodated us with 2 crazy kids. Staff were so attentive, explained kids dishes before we asked also provided colouring paper. Food delicious with so many options and brunch dishes. Definitely we will return.']
title: Beautiful family brunch

content: ["Firstly, the atmosphere at the Ivy is amazing. The setting of the tables are perfect and everything is laid out beautifully. I came for afternoon tea with friends and decided on the Champagne afternoon tea. We waited a while to be served and we asked for our hot drinks to be served a little after our champagne as we wanted to finish our champagne first. We got served our champagne and very soon after we received our tea which got cold by the time we finished our Champagne. I ordered an Earl Grey tea and it tasted disgusting. It would happen to be the first time I have ordered an Earl Grey tea and been disappointed. I then ordered a latte and it was cold. We were given 3 finger sandwiches and 3 mini desserts and two scones each. The scones had raisins in them which were disappointing, it would've been nice to have a plain one."]
title: Disappointing champagne afternoon tea

content: ['I wanted to wait to make sure I’d given this restaurant a fair chance before leaving a review - so this is the comparison of three visits. ', 'On my first visit the service was lacking but the food and venue were lovely. Service was removed from the bill as we had been left pretty much to our own devices all evening and had to ask every time we needed something - including to order. From this occasion the Ivy took on board our feedback and thanked the group for being honest. The manager told me they wanted constructive feedback to learn and ensure a good customer experience. ', 'I’ve dined twice with the Ivy since. And I can say that the service was honestly top notch - the staff didn’t remember us so I believe the service was not to play up for a previous poor experience. ', 'The second dining experience was with the same group of friends for dinner and the third occasion for afternoon tea with a relative. On both occasions the service was wonderful. The staff were very friendly and ensured that we had everything we needed. They took the time to help make selections of food and drinks and generally ensured that we enjoyed our dining experience. ', 'The hostess took time to show me tables in the restaurant for afternoon tea and asked me to pick the one I liked most. That table was then booked for me. During the afternoon tea the staff spoke to us and returned to the table to check on us and top up our tea very. It and then. They were all very polite and professional. The afternoon tea was wonderful and we enjoyed the afternoon at a leisurely pace. ', 'It seemed to me that the Ivy has given itself high standards of service and are working to ensure that high standards are maintained. They were genuinely disappointed that the service was not the ‘Ivy’ standard during our first experience but I believe that was the exception and not the norm. Both experiences afterwards were flawless. ', 'The food and drinks are beautifully presented and tasty. The venue is simply stunning - set on the green at Canary Wharf, with outside and indoor options. You might expect that dinning would be very expensive but it is surprisingly affordable - I was pleasantly surprised. ', 'The staff are welcoming and service is swift. I’d recommend this venue and will dine again soon. ']
title: Three visits to the Ivy

content: ['My last visit was a bit disappointing but the food was good so I decided to book again and try the brunch. I always gave a second chance cause I understand that sometimes can be a bad day for everyone specially for the servers. ', 'In that case was more than a surprise for me. Service perfect, food amazing, everything quick and tasty... the best eggs royals ever. I will came back 100% ']
title: Second visit spotless

content: ["I went to the Ivy last night with a friend who was visiting from Australia and we had the most wonderful time. The service was flawless and the food was spectacular! I can only highly recommended visiting the Ivy at canary wharf, you don't be dissapointed. "]
title: Brilliant food and service!

content: ['2 stars just because of the cocktails and the Tarte Tatin (delicious). The poorest customer service ever experienced in my life.', '-very good in how to make somebody feel uncomfortable, I mean guys...Do you know what a smile is? ', '-if I am still drinking my cocktail, why do you think I have finished with that? UNDER PRESSURE. ', '- unfortunately we didn’t ask for the bill, and it has been given to us, rudely by the unfriendly Alin (Do you know darling you have to look people in the eyes? Specially if you bring the bill... Not requested).', '-oh yes, the 12,5%.... really? Which service? ', '-anyway shame, we really wanted to drink another one, but the frustration of the whole service made us leave (run baby run!)', '- end of the story? If you want a cocktail, they are very nice, so better if you seat on the bar stools, the bartenders seemed nice and more professional. ']
title: UNDER PRESSURE

content: ['We ventured in to the Ivy at Canary Wharf on a Sunday when it was a little more relaxed and less business-lunch-y. The décor is lovely – over the top quirky/opulent. We were seated downstairs on a table for two, where we had a nice view of both the restaurant and the conservatory. The restaurant was fairly busy – lots of couples taking a late lunch, tourists, families – but not packed. ', 'Foodwise, I ordered a mocktail and olives to start, shepherd’s pie and a rhumbaba for dessert. All the food was very good, but dessert was the standout dish for me. It wasn’t like the dense syrupy-circles of sponge topped with a swirl of faux-cream that I loved way back in the kebab houses of my youth. Oh no. This was the real deal – as light as a feather, served with rich, rummy, pouring syrup (I’m smiling at the memory). ', 'The disappointment here was the service. There were lots of waiters around, but never at the right time. No less than three people tried to take our drink orders, our olive momentarily visited another table and trying to make eye contact with anyone to get the bill became a bit of game. ', 'So, go for the food, go for the people watching but don’t go in a hurry!']
title: Food Great, Location Great, Service Not So Great.

content: ['Great food. Wonderful value good central', 'Location. Helpful attentive knowledgable staff. Warm', 'Friendly welcome']
title: Fab food

content: ['Happened to be in Canary Wharf on business and some body suggested the Ivy. The restaurant was very busy albeit was a Wednesday lunch booking. We had a great table on the terrace overlooking the green. It was quite noisy. Staff very attentive. The miso cod in particular was excellent, also recommend tuna noodle dish. But the highlight was the baked Alaska mango dessert and I don’t usually eat pudding! Overall a wonderful dining experience and look forward to returning.']
title: Great food in a lovely location

content: ['Third visit and never disappoints. ', 'Great service and food. Attentive and knowledgeable staff. We had a drinks at bar before our meal, bartender was explaining us characteristics of different whiskeys. Superb! ']
title: Great time

content: ['Love the service', 'Love the food', 'Love the cocktails', 'Love the ambiance', 'The Ivy is always a go, no matter what branch you try', 'I am always sure I ll leave Ivy happy']
title: Always a pleasure

content: ['I went for lunch her with 3 friends for a long overdue catch up. Very good food and service. In particular, the prawn and monkfish curry, followed by baked Alaska. Our waitress was informative and made recommendations when asked but didn’t hurry us, while we caught up and admired the views over the green. We sat upstairs but inside, with the doors open so not in the direct sunlight, had a G&T and watched the world go by. ', 'I will return. ']
title: Catch up with Friends

content: ['Sunday afternoon lunch for 3 for a celebration. We hadn’t booked but this was not a problem. We were seated outside with a view of the screen in the park showing the cricket. This was my second visit, service was impeccable, food delicious especially the puddings. Happy tummies all round. ']
title: Celebratory lunch.

content: ['Met a colleague here for meal after work. Place was very busy but we were seated quickly with reservation. There was live music on outside which made it noisy but was already very noisy inside, not too much of a problem. Wasn’t tempted much by menu but ordered steak, medium rare, it came grey and cold and very over cooked. Sides came a while after, also over cooked. My pet hate - the waiters keeping wine off the table which only works if the service is very good, and it wasn’t, so we ended up waiting and asking for wine every time, until I asked for them to just leave it on table. Slow service (not their fault, just very busy and not enough staff, they were all pleasant) pretty poor food, and over priced. Ivy obviously trying to sweat its brand and doing so very badly. Would not go again.']
title: Just give it a miss

content: ['As a big fan of The Ivy, and having visited some of the other new Ivy, we decided to give this a try after a spot of shopping.', "Sadly, we were disappointed. The restaurant was very noisy, the service poor and the food average. In fact it appeared that many of the staff didn't want to be there - miserable faces, rolling of eyes and unprofessional comments were all part and parcel of our experience. It almost seemed as if there was something going on which was causing an undercurrent of discontent amongst the staff. The young lady who served us was pleasant enough but seemed rushed off her feet, consequently our service was slow, whilst groups of other staff 'lounged' around - some actually leaning against walls chatting. Not what I have come to expect from this chain and I won't recommend or return to this particular branch. "]
title: Disappointed

content: ["The restaurant is in a good location in Canary Wharf, especially if you're visiting in the summer. I really liked the decor - very extravagant and 'over the top' (in a nice way).", 'The restaurant was very busy and I imagine a reservation is advised if visiting in the evenings. Despite how busy it was, I found the staff to be very quick in taking orders but also keeping the balance of not interrupting you constantly. ', "The menu isn't very extensive but the food is good. IMO the best thing about this restaurant is the location and the atmosphere."]
title: Beautiful decor, excellent location & efficient staff

content: ['I visited here with my friend and her daughter and after walking around trying to find somewhere for 30 mins we came across the ivy. We never had a booking but was found a table straight away. It was very busy as it was a Saturday afternoon but the service was great. The food was lovely and very reasonably priced. I will defo return in the future']
title: Loved it

content: ["We have booked a table with a friend of mine whom I haven't seen in 10 years to catch up and to talk about business somehow the manager Gloria got wind of this and pretty much personally looked after us. we had the most amazing food I have had in a long long time the service was second to none. all the waiters and waitresses really looked after us for instance when the filtered table water was running low without asking and a new filled up bottle was already on the table. Furthermore after we enjoyed our delicious meal we've being given a special treat which was absolutely unique it is a very nice restaurant in a great location with very friendly staff and since the manager personally looked after us it was an experience made in heaven. I highly recommend this place and I'm very glad to return anytime."]
title: An incredible experience

content: ["The service was friendly and helpful. I can't deny that. Prices are not value for money. There is no main dish below approx 18 pounds (Not talking about pies or vegetarian meals). You need to add a side dish of approx 5 pounds. Then desserts which are around 8 pounds. Then a drink. You end up with 35-40 pounds per person plus the service charge. Simply not worth it because we stayed hungry even after the dinner. Fish dishes are so small. Lobster linguine is the biggest steal. A plate of macaroni with 100g of lobster, 30 pounds. Oh please. "]
title: Not value for money

content: ["I was here for a lunch with 3 friends. Our waiter was lovely, very attentive but sadly the 2 things I picked were dry and tasteless. I ordered the truffle arancini to start. They are small and were very dry but I was hungry so I ate them. I had asked for my burger to be medium rare and was told they do not do this any more......very surprised at this as I didn't ask for rare. I said as long as it came pink that's fine but I did not want well done. Off he went and what came back, a well done tasteless and dry burger. I couldn't send it back because I was short on time and couldn't wait for something else! There is no excuse for it to be tasteless though in a restaurant like this. In addition to this when we arrived we got given a glass of champagne, very nice. I had 1 more then had to leave the group and get back to work. I was told by our waiter that he would take the champagne off the bill. I had noticed that there were 2 on there as well when I had only had 1 as the first one was complimentary. I now know it was left on so the girls had to pay for it. All in all a very disappointing visit!"]
title: Disappointing lunch today I'm afraid

content: ['I met my friend for lunch on Saturday. The service was very good. The atmosphere was nice, the decorations and view lovely.', 'The food was delicate, thoughtful and tasty. The champagne cocktails where super nice. ', 'We sat, ate and drunk in very relaxed environment, at leisure, we talked for 5 hours. We were not pushed out and they made us feel confortable. It was perfect. ', 'I definitely want to go back. ']
title: Lovely food really nice set up

content: ['We celebrated my birthday here for a Sunday brunch and it was perfect. Service is good and friendly and efficient. Good delicious. We had the crispy duck starter which was amazing as well as the freshly baked warm salt crusted sourdough bread. My husband had the ribeye steak and I had the salmon and asparagus- both excellent! For dessert passion fruit baked Alaska. We were outside on a gorgeous summer afternoon. Could not have been better. We will definitely return there soon.']
title: Excellent!

content: ['We visited this place not knowing too much about what to expect. The food was delicious and on the whole the service was good although a tad slow at times. The lobster linguini was outstanding. I really enjoyed it.']
title: Excellent food

content: ['Visited on May 17th with a couple of friends as a celebration. The atmosphere was wonderful, a really well decorated and vibrant space. ', 'We were greeted promptly by our waitress (unfortunately I can’t remember her name!) who was absolutely lovely. She was available throughout the meal, checking regularly if we needed anything else. ', 'We skipped starters and went straight to mains. All of us enjoyed our food so much, a definite 10/10 all round. A couple of my friends dined off a separate menu which was filled with extra vegan and vegetarian options - a nice surprise for them as we didn’t see this online! ', 'I then had a white chocolate hot chocolate and a dessert (see photo!) which was delightful. ', 'Nothing bad to say about this visit. Would come back in a heartbeat! Well done to everyone at The Ivy Canary Wharf']
title: Incredible

content: ["Lunch on a sunny Friday. Bustling but not heaving. Great food - a friend said the best fish and chips he'd had in a long time - and drink (Seville Gin and Tonic and I'm told one - or two - of the best White Russians in ages). Friendly unfussed service. Very happy customers who will return."]
title: Great food, drink, service

content: ["A relatively new addition to the plethora of dining establishments around Canada Square, The Ivy brings it's renowned stamp of British cuisine to the masses.", 'Probably a good idea to book ahead, although we did manage to get a table on a late Sunday afternoon as a walk in. My favorite is the crispy duck salad followed by fish and chips, whilst my wife tucked into asparagus and lobster, followed by miso cod. Not the cheapest restaurant that you will ever eat at but the food is excellent and the service was very friendly.', '2 courses pp and a modest drink will set you back the best part of £100 inc VAT and service. Saying that, a pleasant dining experience, good for groups and I would go again.']
title: Book ahead!

content: ['Our visit to the Ivy was lovely! We managed to get a table in the terrace, on a busy Saturday morning for brunch. The food was great, would definitely recommend the pistachio and raspberry dessert. Also, our waiter, George, was very welcoming and provides great service. There was also a great atmosphere. Would I return to the Ivy in Canary Wharf? Of course! ']
title: Lovely brunch!

content: ['17 Jan: I enjoyed my weekday evening dinner here. They have a good selection of cocktails, friendly staff, a wide variety of food (something for everyone) and all our dishes were well cooked, tasty and generously portioned. Would happily return.']
title: Great food, wine & cocktails with lovely staff. Will return.

content: ["Was treated by our kids to dinner. The menu is decent and reasonably priced for London. The kids had been here before so were bursting with suggestions. Danielle has a severe nut allergy so we checked with the staff who were very good indeed (some places just think that it isn't too important). They do a craft pale ale which is very nice indeed and a craft lager which Dave enjoyed. The girls had a bottle of prosecco.", "The wine list is a bit pricy with prosecco at £42 but perhaps its just that I don't eat in London often.", 'The arancini balls were good and the matchstick thin zucchini was brilliant. Dave and I had the tempura prawns and they were excellent. We also had the smoked salmon, which was a little salty.', "Jean had the shepherd's pie and Dave and I had the monkfish curry. The curry was fabulous. Danielle tried the black miso cod and was so impressed she gave us all a taste and now wants me to cook it at home.", 'All in all a lovely evening and well worth a return visit.']
title: Nice meal, nice staff

content: ['Great food! Great price! Great ambiance! But best of all..... our waiter.... Filippoi, this guy was AMAZING! I eat in a lot of high end restaurants and this was some of the best, genuine, attentive service I have ever had! Gold star!!! ']
title: 1st class!!!

content: ['Met a friend of mine here and she reserved a table for dinning on the terrace!', 'I have arrived before her and when I mentioned her name they asked me "dining yes?" and I said "no, we are not having dinner!" and so they cancelled her booking and moved me inside because outside is apparently just for dining. ', 'Let me start from the beginning. ', "This place is aesthetically lovely, I got so excited when they opened the Ivy in Canary Wharf! I've been wanting to try it for quite some time now, and i got the opportunity with my friend. ", 'I do not think is a smart way of organising the space by "if you proper eat with us and spend a lot of money, then you can eat outside!" if you don\'t expect to eat (people can change their mind by any chance?) then you sit inside. This for me is a terrible way of doing business. ', ' ', 'Why not creating an outside space for people who are not planning right at that moment to order food; and an allocated space for people who actually want to have lunch/dinner there? ', "Now.. I wonder if I ordered a 5k bottle of wine but I don't want to sit inside - what would you guys do? This should improve, especially as there is people with money coming to your place and leave big tips!", 'In addition, I confirm as some reviews mentioned here, that the staff is not very smiley or engaging a lot! I felt (but again it might be just me) that they had some kind of attitude in certain situation! ', 'Would I go back? Yes, but I hope it gets better. ', 'Value: 7']
title: Not approved! - Things to improve

content: ['As i sometimes work from the Thomson Reuters offices in Canary Wharf, I end up staring at this restaurant from the break room.', "From a distance and up close it's a very interesting looking building within an oddly green area of the Wharf, I was hoping for good weather so I could enjoy their extensive outdoor seating but the UK weather intervened so we ended up indoors.", 'Front of house good, whisked to table upstairs in short order even though we turned up 20 minutes early. Asked for drinks and food order to be taken later, no issues with that. ', 'Put in a table for 2 next to the window, good view, just be aware that it can be a little cold next to the glass. Be wary of this in winter but they do have overhead heaters.', "Wine list decent, prices London standard but you don't need to spend mega bucks on a bottle as some of the cheaper options were decent (according to Vivino analysis).", 'Settled on a couple of glasses of English sparking which were good and some US Zin which was very drinkable along with an order of truffle arancini which was cracking.', 'Starter:prawn and lobster cocktail, fresh tasting, good sauce, maybe actually a little too big but it sounds odd to complain about that.', "Main: Iberico pork chop, cracking piece of meat, maybe some of the best pork I've had.", 'Dessert: Apple Tart, not bad, decent portion size but felt like there was something missing.', 'Cost: £200 including service charge, 2 people, 3 courses each, 1 bottle wine,fizz each to start and glass of wine at the end.', 'All in all, a good visit to the upmarket chain. No drama, plenty of staff and service was good. Would be more than happy to return.']
title: Solid Eatery

content: ['A very nice restaurant in Canary Wharf...great atmosphere with excellent food! The Tempura Prawns and the Steak Tartare were excellent...3 of us had different mains and all were great!!!! For a place like this, the prices were reasonable.']
title: Delectable!!!!!

content: ['Great service, lovely live music, delicious food and a thoroughly enjoyable experience. Very reasonable given the quality. We will return!']
title: WONDERFUL

content: ['Beautiful restaurant, delicious food and amazing staff I would like to thank Stefano for the amazing service, thank you for making our stay even more wonderful.']
title: Amazing

content: ['Beautiful restaurant beautiful location beautiful decor amazing service but at these prices the food is mediocre at best Would say gastro pub level at around 3x the price']
title: Style over substance

content: ["From the moment we arrived, we knew this would be special. Lovely spot to view the large screen outside, exceptionally courteous waiting staff, beautifully presented food that tasted delicious. Fabulous time at this restaurant today. Thank you for listening and responding to feedback. I'll be back again and again."]
title: Second time around - pefection!

content: ['We visited the restaurant over the Bank Holiday weekend.', 'The Wharf was reasonably quiet as one would expect but the restaurant was extremely busy which is always a good sign.', 'The food was great. I had the rib eye steak with sides of Truffle and Parmesan chips, creamed spinach and green beans which I shared with my wife who went for the Chicken Milanese.', "For some reason, our table wasn't dressed with a white tablecloth like I would have expected for the Ivy. Maybe it was decor related as the round tables wasn't dressed yet the square tables were dressed? Who knows. Not a problem at all. I also grains of rice in with the Truffle and Parmesan chips. That stood out like a sore thumb to me. The restaurant was busy but there was no way that should have happened. I didn't sent it back as it wasn't a major issue (and I was hungry and didn't want further delay to my food!)", "The food was great though. The chocolate bombe desert was quite possibly my favourite desert for a very very long time. It was exceptional. I'd come back to the Ivy purely for that desert alone.", 'Parents of babies be warned. Although there are baby change facilities, there is very little room between tables for a buggy. When we made our booking, we indicated that we would be bringing our month old daughter with us, so we was accommodated for but be aware that if you turn up unannounced then you may run into difficulties.', "Good value for money based on the standard of food to price paid. With my wife working on the Canary Wharf estate, this restaurant will be on our list of go to's for the foreseeable future."]

', 'We were then left to our own devices and had empty glasses. I had to get up and personally find our white wine and pour it out for the table .. incredible. ', 'My wife then went to the toilet and found there were no hand towels at all, to dry her hands.', 'All in all the evening was not what we expected. I eat at The Ivy Liverpool Street frequently with clients and friends, and it is so so much better . ', 'When were ordered our last drinks I made the waitress aware of our terrible evening and a lovely manager ( Gloria ) came and listened to my moans and immediately went off and came back with a substantial amount off the bill which was a lovely gesture..', 'However as I said to Gloria I would rather have paid the whole amount and enjoyed a wonderful evening, to celebrate our good friend’s 60th birthday, than had an unpleasant one. ', 'I would like to thank Gloria as she did her best. ', 'The other manager, apart from delivering the main courses did very little.', 'We eat out at least 3 times each week and will not rush to drive 1hour 20mins into to the city for average food and poor service to celebrate something special, when we can have a far better locally.', 'I appreciate that not everyone has this type of experience but I for one sadly will never go back to the ivy Canary Wharf']
title: Dinner for 60th birthday celebration

content: ['Reading other reviews, I’m surprised as we found the service to be fine. It could have been faster, but overall welcome and attention to deal were good. The ambience is really nice, stylish, warm and comfortable. The husband really enjoyed his pancakes, and the sourdough bread was delicious, I had eggs royale. I like to think I’m a bit of a connoisseur of this dish, and although the eggs were perfectly poached they were a bit mean with the salmon and hollandaise sauce, but I still enjoyed it. Overall it was a lovely Sunday brunch experience. ']
title: Excellent brunch

content: ['We were not told that certain dishes were unavailable when ordering so had that initial disappointment, we then ordered what we were told was the last of the dish but subsequently were told that was not available, so had to order again. Then the accompaniments did not arrive until we had finished. I raised this with the manager who said he would give me a coffee and a free meal next time. I waited for the coffee for 15 minutes, it did not arrive and the manager was talking, for an inordinate amount of time to another customer. Literally the most jaw dropping service experience of my life! I followed this up with feedback on their website and have never had a response, this was almost a month ago now..........just woeful. Having eaten at the original Ivy, i cannot help but feel they have overstretched and will end up like many other chains.']
title: DISREGARD FOR THE CUSTOMER

content: ['I gave this restaurant a 4/5 the food was great but we were visited by 3 members of staff who all just went off and did nothing. There seems to be more chiefs than workers here all who seem a little afraid to do things wrong? Talk about micro management. Back to the food it was well presented and well cooked. Overall very nice. Shame about the service though or I would have marked higher. The soup and the curry were very tasty off the main menu as was the scallops and chicken. Like most restaurants nowadays too expensive for bottled alcohol. The food was well worth the price.']
title: Too dark

content: ['This is a good find in Canary Wharf, minutes from the tube and DLR station. Great atmosphere, with excellent service and food to match. For the location, the restaurant offers great food at a reasonable price, the drinks, however, are quite expensive.', 'The atmosphere in the evening is good, the music perhaps a little too loud and lighting a little too low - I struggled to read my menu in the dim lighting.']
title: Good find in the hustle and bustle of Canary Wharf

content: ['Had dinner here after a movie. The service was good with plenty of attentive people - the food was really good with plenty if choice on the menu. My criticisms would be that the lighting is a bit low and when the place is busy the noise is quite high. Worth a visit though.']
title: Good food and service but atmos[here a bit lacking

content: ["Let's start with the positives. The vista is impressive; plenty of tall shiny buildings in a cosy and warm environment. Praise also for Mariana, with her warmth and knowledge of the food and wines.", 'The downside is this restaurant appears to suffer from one or more of understaffing/training issues/management/owner investment. Maybe this is a sign of things to come due to Brexit and the lack of EU citizens coming to the UK. As the place became moderately busy during the evening, the level of service collapsed.', 'We waited 25 minutes for our dessert. When it arrived, the service was uncoordinated and the server appeared agitated. We ordered a dessert consisting of a chocolate hemisphere. A hot sauce is poured on top and the thing melts and is transformed. This works well if firstly you are told to wait for the sauce, then secondly, the sauce is produced soon afterwards. Sadly this did not happen, and my guest smashed into his chocolate without the sauce or the magic.', 'My cheese selection arrived almost straight out of the fridge, so lacked flavour. It’s worth mentioning that all of this comes at a price; the Ivy is not cheap.', 'Given the concentration of purchasing power among the City people who work in those tall shiny buildings, I have always been puzzled why this area lacks quality restaurants. Sadly, unless this Ivy at Canary Wharf gets it act together, it will remain no better than an expensive high street chain with bad service.']
title: Poor service and understaffed

content: ['We visit most of the Ivy collections. Quite a fan. This one didn’t disappoint. Food great, delivered on time. Reception pleasant. Rich our waiter was super attentive. Manager a little fail. Trying to push Pinot Gris saying it’s just like expensive Pinot Grigio. Nice try! “Fail” and then the lights. All of the constantly flickering. We didn’t had desserts, because of slight headache. Still a nice visit hence 4 stars! ', 'We would go back only if the lights are fixed and managers gets a little more humble! ']
title: Nice if you don’t have photo sensitive epilepsy

content: ['Like all recent Ivy brands, not as good as the original. ', 'they go heavy on the foliage and the outside area is nice to chill in after work but at £16 for a small glass of Pinot noir it wasn’t welcoming for wine drinkers.', 'We were sitting at the bar and even then it was hard to get served at. ', 'I ddI enjoy my chicken schnitzel but hard to get wrong. ', 'Truffle aroncini starter was lovely as was the trademark frozen berries dessert, but again, hard to get wrong. ', 'A good place to go if it’s on expenses. ']
title: Few drinks & meal after work

content: ['Arranged a dinner for three here for this week, we all worked together in the past and enjoy a good meal and a chat, well here we got one of the two!', 'Arrived on time for a 5.30 booking shown straight to a table, given menus and the drinks list, we mentioned that we were still waiting on one member of the party so would take our time, despite this we were asked three times if we were ready to order! If only this keeness could remain all evening. In the end we ordered the bread to gain some space.', 'When the last member of the party arrived we had to try hard to attract the staff attention to order drinks, when we managed this they took some time to arrive.', 'We took the opportunity to order food when the drinks arrived, starters were mozzarella, tempura prawns and scallops. These were reasonable but not outstanding.', 'The mains, Shepard’s pie, with mixed green veg, and two specials of halibut with different green veg. All the mains arrived together, but no sides, we asked and were told they were coming. My guests had a caper sauce with the fish, this was stone cold, they asked if this was correct and were told by the waiter that it should be room temperature, it was not even that. We asked for it to warmed, it was but by then they were half way through their fish, and there was still no sides. We asked again, and these we reordered urgently and arrived after another wait. So so poor.', 'We decided not to have a sweet, but went for coffee, but cold cappuccino is not nice, so we added the extra hot milk from the white americano.', 'The service here is poor, lack of attention to detail. If you like your mains and sides arriving 10/15 minutes apart and cold sauces on fish then this is the place for you, however if you are a normal diner then avoid this place until they can get their act together.', 'We asked for the bill and it arrived along with the card machine! I said I would like to look at the bill first and then pay it, staff came back three times in five minutes with the machine - considering they were not busy and it was only 7.45 I can only assume that they were waiting to close up! To add insult to this saga, there was an automatic 12.5% service charge ', 'I have now been to 7 different outlets of this group and they are either very good or very bad, with the latter in the majority so I suspect that this will be the last that we try. Thank god for the chat with friends otherwise the evening would have been a complete disaster.']
title: Another poor Ivy, not a patch on the original

content: ['A friend and I went for dinner last week. When we arrived we were warmly welcomed and seated upstairs. Throughout the evening the service was very good and the staff were all attentive, friendly and professional. They went out of their way so that we could have a good evening. ', 'The decor was impressive, however the lighting made it difficult to read the menu. We were placed on a table sitting next to each other and would have preferred a table where we could sit opposite each other. Unfortunately, there were no other tables available. ', 'The menu is extensive and our food was really good and tasty, they were also big portions. ', 'Overall, a good experience and would recommend.']
title: Good food and great value for money

content: ['I must admit the young ladies on reception are very nice and made you feel welcome ', 'I took a chance for a table and they fitted us in by the bar which was ok', 'The waiters on the other hand need to be more like the reception staff - never felt welcomed by them', 'As for the food I’d was really nice the fish cake with the duck egg was the best fish cake I ever had ', 'Overall really good and would return but the waiters need to lighten up']
title: Very good but

content: ['Friday evening (7pm) at the Ivy. Food was really good, from the starter to the main and the dessert. The place was quite crowded, and the staff seemed a bit stressed. Unfortunately, the music was annoyingly loud. Not really my preference to shout all the time in a restaurant. ']
title: Good food

content: ["Fantastic looking place and a really nice ambiance inside with great views, The Wharf has been missing a good all day higher end brasserie-style restaurant. We turned up at 17:30 without a reservation and was told there was a table until 7. This was fine - our plan was a main and dessert. Drinks and bread came quickly. The order was taken at 17:48 and then no food until 18:45. Fish and Chips were soggy, and the chicken Milanese was not seasoned at all. Had to ask for Ketchup 3 times; finally arrived once we had finished eating. No time for dessert as had to give the table back, other tables around us having the same issue being asked to leave. Clearly, the kitchen was in trouble and front of house needs training, for somewhere that's meant to be higher end than the other options in the wharf I was quite surprised. Having been to the original ivy - the service was just not there. To be fair - at the end, the manager came over without being asked and removed the drinks from our bill. So will put this down to them having a bad day - will come back and try their Saturday Brunch in a few months when things have settled down."]
title: Needs some work!

content: ['Went with friends for lunch. The waiting staff were excellent and looked after us very well. The food was good quality and the menu was quite varied. The wine was good value too. We booked and glad we did as the restaurant was full for most of the lunch period. Definitely worth a visit and it does not break the bank either.']
title: great atmosphere and food

content: ["Booking made for a birthday celebration, three people, Sunday brunch menu. First impressions of the premises was good, attractive restaurant, in great location to Canary Wharf shops and station. Warmly greeted, but the reception area full of buggies that could have been left elsewhere. Shown to a lovely table upstairs with view of the ice rink. Orders taken promptly by a friendly server. One of our party ordered eggs Benedict, another the pancakes, and the monkfish prawn curry for myself. When the food arrived, initial reaction was that the curry portion was small, minimal prawns and little chunks of monkfish. The monkfish however was tough and could have passed for poorly cooked lamb in texture. The server apologised and took the curry away, after I'd said that should the monkfish be the same in kitchen, to replace it with more prawn. My husband and daughter had of course finished their meals by then, my daughter having enjoyed the Eggs Benedict, and my husband finding the pancakes nondescript. After waiting 15 minutes my meal arrived, served by one of the managers apologising for the problem. To my dismay, noticed that the replacement dish contained only three prawns, the same amount that had been left in the dish originally, ( i would add the prawns were only small , all could have fitted on a dessert spoon, this is being generous) all floating in the curry sauce. Additionally, no thought had been made to replace the side dishes of vegetables which were now stone cold. The Manager asked if he could replace the food, but by then as everyone had finished, i politely refused. He did offer a dessert or a glass of champagne, but again this was declined. When the bill arrived, the curry had been deducted, plus one cup of coffee. I thought this was a miserly gesture, particularly as it had been a celebration meal, poor food and we had not eaten together. I would say that some chocolates and a mini pastry had been left on the table which was acknowledged with thanks. Overall this was not a good dining experience, not one that I would expect from the Ivy chain of cafes."]
title: Style over substance

content: ['3rd visit to one of the newer Ivy chain restaurants (which are not part of the original Ivy in Covent Garden) ', "Nice atmosphere for a Sunday afternoon, good staff. Lovely cocktails, whilst I wouldn't rate the food as outstanding it was overall a very pleasant visit. "]
title: Sunday Afternoon

content: ['The Ivy in the Park - Canary Wharf, London', 'Cuisine: Traditional and Modern English', 'Style Points: 4/5', 'Location: Canary Wharf', 'Price: ££££', 'Overall: 4/5', 'A long time fan of the original establishment, it’s safe to say that I was excited to dine at The Ivy in the Park. Located right in the heart of Canary Wharf, the restaurant is only three months young but the expectations are naturally always high with The Ivy.', 'Our table was booked for 6.30pm and by the time we arrived the place was already full but we were welcomed with friendly and approachable staff. ', 'Food?', 'We decided on something like to ‘nibble’ on first and tried the Truffle Arancini, which were delicate balls of fried Arborio rice fragrant with the lovely aroma of truffle cheese. They were a delight and went really well with our cocktail, the Aviation Illumination, served in a quirky bulb glass to fit the Winter Lights taking place in Canary Wharf during January. ', 'For starters, we tried the Crispy Duck Salad and Marinated Yellowfin Tuna. Both starters did no disappoint. The flavours in the Duck Salad were extraordinary and the pairing of juicy watermelon chunks with pieces of warm crispy five-spiced duck was inspired.', 'Yellowfin tuna is always a winner but the marinade was excellent and the wasabi mayonnaise really brought the dish together. ', 'For mains, I decided to go with the Chicken Bourguignon - flat-ironed chicken with beautifully crispy skin, creamed potato, chestnut mushrooms and bacon lardons. The chicken was incredibly tender and moist and went extremely perfectly with the creamy mushroom and salty bacon lardons. The mash was not too buttery which was good and the whole dish was seasoned perfectly. ', 'My guest went for the dish of the day - Game Pie with handmade pastry, baby carrots and baked sweet potato. This was a ‘proper’ pie with a flaky shortcrust bottom and not just a pastry top. The meat was juicy, tender and there was plenty of filling, whilst the accompaniments to the dish were cooked perfectly. ', 'Of course, we saved room for dessert and went with the recommendations of our server - Melting Chocolate Bombe with a honeycomb centre served theatrically of course with hot salted caramel sauce poured on top. With these sorts of desserts, you can be disappointed as sometimes the taste of the Bombe does not live up to the theatre. However, this Bombe did not disappoint. It was every type of adjective you want a chocolate dessert to be associated with - gooey, rich, warming, decadent, oozing, sweet, sticky...I could go on! ', 'My guest went with our second recommendation - Apple Tart Fine - freshly made apple tart with vanilla ice cream and again served theatrically with Calvados Flambé. The tart was not too sweet and the pastry was crisp and flaky. You can’t go wrong with what is essentially apple pie and vanilla ice cream however, I think the dessert would’ve tasted better without the Calvados Flambé, which was a little too strong and overpowering. ', 'Price?', 'The price is reflective of the name of the establishment and the area of London it is situated in. However, there are some reasonably priced dishes on the menu and you won’t feel short-changed when it comes to portion sizes. ', 'Overall? ', 'The Ivy in the Park did not disappoint. The food was of a very high quality, the service was great, and it was a fantastic experience overall. Whether you work or live in the area or are just visiting, I would definitely recommend The Ivy in the Park as a place to try some great dishes of high quality.']
title: Mid-week dining at The Ivy in the Park

content: ['When a place you\'re spending money in makes you feel less than welcome, ultimately the excellent food leaves a very bad taste. When 3 tables are seated at exactly the same time yet only the table with 3 black women are rushed out before dessert because they\'ve been there for "2 hours", there\'s only one conclusion one can reach. Such a shame this still occurs in 2019.']
title: Does your face fit? Then go

content: ['I recently had drinks at The Ivy Canary Wharf during the Winter Lights and I must say it was absolutely delightful. The service was fantastic, really attentive staff, had some nibbles and a desserts to accompany this. From start to finish my guest and I were very impressed. At times there were a few slip ups but these were quickly rectified by our waiter. ', 'It is a shame that they seem to be getting a tough time with people insinuating that they are racist. This is simply not true, unfounded and very defamatory to the brand and wonderful team that work there. It is in very poor taste and I can only say that you should go and experience the brilliance the team and restaurant have to offer. ', 'Before any one gets offended, I too am a woman of colour who has visited the establishment several times and felt nothing but warmth and kindness from all I engaged with.']
title: A cosy space after the chill of The Winter Lights!!

content: ['Had a lovely time here for lunch, the lobster linguini was tasty and my daughter had the steak sandwich which she said was delicious!', 'Beautiful decor and our waitress Hagia was so nice and very professional.', 'Can’t wait to visit again!']
title: Helen D

content: ['My wife and I have now visited the Ivy in the Park on two separate occasions and have found it to be as good as the original location.', 'Service was excellent and the staff are fully knowledgable about what is, to all intents and purposes, a standard menu across the chain. The shepherds pie was indeed excellent and just as we have experienced at West Street (the original).', "A lot of effort has gone into making the interior seem as though it is straight from the 1930's and once inside you would not think the place is brand new. Tables are close together, but no more than you would find at West Street.", 'The Ivy in the Park is a welcome addition tor restaurants in Canary Wharf and is well worth a visit at the weekends. We booked ahead on the day and found a table so always worth a try - we have put this now on our regular list.']
title: As Good As The Original

content: ["My fiancee and I went here for our evening meal prior to going out for the evening on a Friday night. We arrived early and we were seated at our table which over looked the ice rink which was delightful! We were pressured to order drinks every few minutes and we weren't given time to look at the menus it was as if they wanted to rush us out yet it was half empty, it was only 5pm! We ordered some drinks and some sourdough bread to share as a starter which was great I must add... However as soon as the waiter picked up the empty bread basket within 10 seconds our mains were on the table and that was no exaggeration!!! How can we be expected to eat a main within seconds of eating our starters. There was zero breathing space between the two courses it was rush rush rush. We both didn't finish our meals as a result of this. I complained to a member of staff whom got his manager. The manager was very apologetic and so rightly so! She did remove our mains from the bill which was good of her but still it doesn't make up for the nice evening that was ruined by forcing us out the door. Ivy Park you lost out on good customers here. We shall not be returning! "]
title: Ivy Pants not Ivy Park!!!

content: ['Lovely decor and great food! Really good that they offer all day dining and you can also have a quick meeting over coffee. Great service too!']
title: Excellent!

content: ['I went in a group of 6 people. Every appetizer, main course, and dessert was outstanding. Everyone was blown away by the delicious food. Nice views and atmosphere too. Huge, diverse menu. Not cheap but for what you get prices are a good value.']
title: One of the best meals I've ever had

content: ["Went to have brunch here with a couple friend and my 18-year old daughter this December and was very happy with the experience. From the Ivy Royale (a sparkling cocktail that was just impossible to resist) to the Chicken Milanese and the Chocolate Bombe- everything was really good! I also liked the fact that despite it being full, we couldn't hear other people's conversations. Loved the vibe. I have been to many places where you pay for the ambience and nothing else. The Ivy in the Park is not one of those. Will definitely be back on my next trip."]
title: Lovely weekend brunch

content: ['We ate at The Ivy in the Park the Friday evening before Christmas. The restaurant was beautifully decorated for the festive season. We were welcomed on arrival and given a table in the bar area for pre dinner cocktails. Our dinner table was upstairs where the subtle lighting, huge glass windows and foliage create a magical ambiance. We all enjoyed our meals. I’d personally recommend the Black Cod. Service was very good and we had a relaxed but excellent meal. ', 'The restaurant has a great location. A short walk from Canary Wharf station. Definitely one to return to. ']
title: Perfect evening.

content: ['Weekend brunch was lovely. We was seated straight away. The service was ok. ', 'The staff was nice. Maybe because they was busy but the staff kept forgetting little things. ', 'We wanted ketchup and mayo: we had to ask another waitress for it. We ordered two chocolate bombs and only was given one.', 'Again had to ask the waitress if it’s just the one they given us and she said yes. Had to explain we ordered two! But told them don’t worry we just keep the one! So slightly disappointed in their service! ', 'The food was nice but service could’ve been better. Atmosphere and venue was lovely and prices are affordable ']
title: Lovely brunch

content: ['I went with friends for coffee ! Was really nice ! I like their crème brûlée so delicious even chocolate bombe was amazing ', 'I definitely recommend it ', 'Well done ']
title: Really nice !

content: ['Met up with a group of friends from high school some of them I’ve not seen for more than 30 years. We had a great time. Food was fantastic and the atmosphere was superb. Will definitely be going back.']
title: Fabulous!!!!

content: ["We booked for the Ivy for an early dinner on new year's eve. We wanted to eat at around 8pm but only 7pm was available online. We visited the restaurant earlier in the day to check if there was a later time but there wasn't. As we were getting ready I got a call to say that we could arrive later as there had been cancellations. We were really impressed that they had made the effort to contact us. On arrival we were warmly welcomed and seated upstairs. My seat was on a comfy banquette but my husband told me later that he kept being bumped by people walking past so felt like he was in a corridor. From the menu we selected the truffled orzo pasta and the scallops for starters, which were both good, then tuna loin and shepherds pie for mains with sides of spinach and truffle chips. It turned out that the sides probably weren't needed but we succumbed to the upselling from the waitress. Both main dishes were very good, well cooked and flavoursome. For dessert we shared the passion fruit baked Alaska, which was a nice balance of sweet and tangy. To drink we shared an entry-price bottle of Bordeaux which we enjoyed. Water was topped up regularly. It was a nice atmosphere and service was good apart from the upselling. Overall a very nice meal."]
title: Good experience

content: ['Was proposed the Ivy as it’s new and well I was not disappointed. The place it’s a very comfortable garden room with the elegance of fine dinning with a more relaxed feel. The staff were great and the food was fantastic.']
title: Breakfast

content: ['We had Sunday lunch at the Ivy. We were quite excited in having a new restaurant in the area. The decor at Ivy is lovely. It’s colourful and has lots of plants giving a feeling of freshness in the restaurant. We were seated in the top floor and had good views.', 'We started with courgette fritters which was lovely and plenty. For starters my wife ordered yellowfin tuna while I ordered crispy duck salad. We loved both of are starters. For mains we both ordered the miso black cod- we love this dish and we’re not disappointed. ', 'The service was great and we were well looked after. We will definitely be coming back.']
title: Nice decor and lovely food

content: ['I love the Ivy chain and this one is lovely and quirky and exceptionally clean. We popped in for a quick lunchtime drink and the care and attention taken in making and serving them was a delight.', 'Lots of outdoor space with lovely blankets.', 'We will definitely return to this one as it really was comfortable and the decor inspiring. ']
title: Reliable

content: ['My and 3 of my friends went for dinner. We were excited as it all looked very nice. The decor was beautiful. 2 of us ordered seabass dish, the waiter took our orders all OK. After about 30 minutes of waiting, the waiter came back to say they have run out of seabass. So, then we placed another option. The order came, I ordered the salmon which was nice. Overall, beautiful decor, service poor. Also, be aware the floor is very slippery!']
title: Waiters/waitresses need to be quicker and more on the ball!

content: ['I have visited pretty much all of the Ivy’s in London, and they’re one of my favourite restaurants. We thought we’d try the new one in Canary Wharf and were excited to do so.', 'I have to say, we weren’t disappointed! It’s probably my favourite one. It’s done up so pretty and overlooks the ice rink.', 'The bar there was great and the barmen kept us entertained. Walter was a great host and made sure we always had a cocktail (although there was no candy floss for the candy floss cocktail).', 'The steak was a bit on the colder side and the chips had to be sent back as they were inedible, the spinach could have done with going back too but we kept it. ', 'Because the service had been so good it didn’t ruin our night, and we had a great night - we will definitely return ']
title: Christmas dinner & cocktails

content: ['Love this place. The menu is extensive, the food really good the service is great and the decor is lovely. Reasonably priced too. Will definitely return very soon.']
title: Great addition to Canary wharf

content: ['The good lady and I visited for dinner on a Saturday night. We were seated on the first floor overlooking the Ice Rink Canary Wharf. The staff are great, very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.', 'There was music playing down stairs but not overly loud and we had no issues with it.', 'It’s quite sophisticated but laid back a great place to dine.', 'The bill was not spiteful, in fact very reasonable.', 'Can’t wait to return.']
title: Loved the Ivy.....

content: ['I visited the Ivy in the park this evening for dinner with my mum as part of an early Xmas gift.', 'The decor is beautiful, we were sat upstairs overlooking the ice rink. The service was outstanding.', 'We both had a classic champagne cocktail.', 'For starters the duck and watermelon dish- beautiful.', 'Mains the shepherds pie and the shoulder of lamb with green beans and wilted spinach.', 'I could have eaten more of the Sheppard’s pie ifs the portion was bigger. ', 'For desert we had the creme brûlée and the rum baba.', 'The atmosphere and food were equally great. I would advise you to book ahead as it is very popular.', '5/5! ']
title: Highly recommend

content: ["As with every Ivy off shoot, this branch carries the same menu and similar decor to the original in West Street so you always know what you're going to get. You can eat expensive, or inexpensive depending on your pocket on the day, but one thing's for certain...you'll always have a phenomenal meal.", 'The staff here are awesome, and the atmosphere great too. What a perfect way to start the evening, with perfect food and perfect wine....thank you Ivy']

content: ["My first visit to the Ivy in Canary Wharf which has been open for around a month now. Many of the restaurants in Canary Wharf are a disappointment being soul less, average quality at best, and poor value, but the Ivy does raise the standard with a good location, generally good service, but could be better which hopefully will come as they get established. Could not complain about the food and wine all in line with other Ivy's, so will certainly be returning on a regular basis."]
title: A great addition to Canary Wharf.........

content: ['Upon my arrival into the restaurant the service received was warm, welcoming, accommodating and very professional. ', 'A wide option of choice for drinks: Jamaican Wray & Nephew white rum was there. The food was delicious ', 'Overall: a humbling experience ', 'I would like to use this opportunity to say Thank you to the staff for providing an wonderful experience ']
title: Superb

title: Fantasic food and lovely atmosphere

content: ['We turned up without reservation and they went out of their way to make sure we got a table and did not go elsewhere. Very nice service, felt valued as a customer. Food and drinks were up to the Ivy standard, we had a great meal here.']
title: Exceptional service

content: ["Was very excited to see the Ivy being built in Canary Wharf and eventually we managed a lunch booking last week. Was surprised how busy it was even though we got there early. However service was good and our food and drinks came quickly. title: Another Ivy restaurant

content: ['Was taken there after a meeting recently and having heard of, but never eaten in any of the Ivy chain, I was looking forward to the occasion. ', 'The restaurant is bright, in places, with a nice buzz. The service was good, attentive without being intrusive. Wines can be pricey if you have the budget.', 'The food was good. title: It was like a Cliff Richard concert with good food.

content: ['Such a nice atmosphere, top quality food and of course a friendly and attentive staff.Hope will be coming back soon.!']

content: ['Excellent place! Enjoyed all of it from the first moment We’ve walked in. Staff was great and professional, food was really tasty. Definitely coming back again!']
title: VS

title: Great service

title: Great for date night

content: ['Excellent new addition to Canary Wharf. Tasteful interior, good attentive service and great food.', 'We arrived very late near closing but were not rushed and had a lovely late dinner. ']
title: Beautiful restaurant, great food

content: ['The restaurant is very beautiful and the food is delicious and flavoury. You can definitely spend a relaxing evening here.']
title: Beautiful experience

content: ['In a few words: My friend and I had a trully exceptional experience at the Ivy in The Park last week. I would highly recommend this restaurant and we will be definitely coming back here ourselves very soon.', 'To begin with, we were warmly greeted and felt welcome from the very first second we set our foot in - which is no longer the case in many restaurants in London...', 'We were shown to our table and our waitress, Lavignia, who was so sweet and polite, took the time to explain the menu, inform us about what was unavailable and make suggestions based on our preferences.', 'Starters: we shared the foie gras and the crispy duck salad between the two of us and both were delicious!! The foie gras was served on a brioche toast with roasted apples and was so juicy and yummy, I cannot even describe... as for the duck salad - well we could both have more and more of it, the freshness of the watermelon in combination with the crispiness of the duck and the taste of the hoisin sauce was so refreshing and almost addictive. Both starters are a no-miss for anyone who visits!', "Mains: I had the monkfish and prawn curry which came with jasmine rice on the side and was one of the best I've had. The monkfish was a tiny bit chewy but that's very often the case with monkfish so I didn't mind at all. Overall it was a hearty dish, very fragrant and just a bit spicy - just the way I like it, so extremely happy with my choice - which was our waitress suggestion btw.", 'Here I need to mention that the whole team was very attentive, fast and polite in their interactions with us. Alex, I think he is the manager, even came to personally check upon us and make sure we were happy with everything and get our feedback.', 'Also, you need to pay a visit to the restrooms, as they are beautifully designed (...and highly instagrammable)!', 'To sum up: we were both SO happy with our time here! Thank you for taking care of us, we will be back very soon for more!']
title: Great dinner in a beautiful set-up!

content: ["A welcome addition to Canary Wharf, great interior with attentive service - perfect for both breakfast and lunch meetings - but sadly lacking decent vegetarian options which pulls it right down in my estimation. title: Poor Selection of Vegetarian Options

content: ["Tried out the new venue in Canary Wharf and wasn't disappointed. Would love to try the breakfast as the views look amazing. A special shout out to Roxanne who was just great! The restaurant is lucky to have you. Definitely recommend, looking forward to going back."]
title: Dinner catch up

title: Lunch with friends from wofk

title: Amazing food and service, highly recommend!

content: ["We visited the restaurant for my sister's birthday. The restaurant is in a beautiful building with the most amazing decorations outside and inside. The staff was very friendly, helpful and efficient from the time we arrived at the restaurant. The bar staff was very helpful to explain and recommend cocktails, just like the waiting staff who even though were busy they took the time to explain and recommend dishes. The service was fast and efficient and the food arrived promptly. Everything we had was amazingly delicious. At the end of the meal, we even got a small but delicious cake and a Happy Birthday song for my sister which made the experience even better. I would definitely recommend this restaurant, and we will be back!"]
title: Amazing Restaurant, Amazing Service, Delicious Food and Perfect Cocktails

content: ['It really was a tale of 2 halves.', 'We arrived an hour early and were greeted by a really lovely lady who found us a table for drinks. We opted for the salted caramel espresso martini and a table for 2 opposite the bar and close to the dj.', 'Great ambience, interesting decor and a plethora of happy smiling staff.', 'When our table was ready we were guided upstairs to our table with views of Plateau in one direction and the Ice Rink in the other. Quite a busy night upstairs and we instantly noticed there were a lot less staff there.', 'The manager Valerio was very attentive, spoke passionately about The Ivy,, guided us through the popular choices on the menu and we felt in safe hands.', 'From this point forward the food and service were hit and miss.', 'We had a second set of drinks and some water and ordered our food and my friend ordered a glass of wine.', 'To start we had the courgette which was julienned and battered and served like matchstick chips in a basket and wooden tongs. Absolutely delicious. The sauce it came with was far too acidic but tolerable in small amounts. The scallops ( we were assured there were 6 in a portion), appeared about table as a portion of 2 on top of a weird sauce and very very undercooked inedible butternut squash. This was not a good dish!', 'For mains we has the Shepherds Pie which smelt comforting and rich and looked as yummy as it tasted.', 'The lamb shoulder was one of the most depressing mains I have had this year. The veg carrots and parsnips were lukewarm and undercooked again. The lamb itself had a eye wateringly strong and sour wasabi smeared thickly on top. The first bite was interesting the subsequent mouthful were a mistake.', "We really didn't fancy dessert after that. Valerio knew we weren't happy and offered us a post dinner drink or dessert but the disappointing savoury courses didnt entice us to stay longer.", 'I had such high hopes and am hoping that the kitchen just had an off day. I will go back as it is welcome relief to have somewhere new to go for a dinner treat and fingers crossed that dinner will be everything that other reviewers say.']
title: 2 for dinner

content: ['The ivy on the park has a great atmosphere and for such a new restaurant the service and food is amazing. It is in the centre Of Canary Wharf and should not be missed. We sat upstairs which was lovely.']

', 'We placed a second order for truffle-parmesan chips, which were hot and delicious. ', 'There seems to a weird food transfer / holding pattern where the food is brought out from the kitchen, taken through to a crockery dresser where it sits on the tray and waits to be taken to the table. ", 'All in all a reasonable brunch, not brilliant, but not terrible. Hopefully with time these small issues will be resolved. ']
